name: CompileAzureDscPullServerMofs
friendlyName: Compile Azure DSC Pull Server MOFs
description: Compile DSC configurations into MOF files for your Azure Automation DSC Pull Server. This should be run after the Publish DSC Configurations to ensure required modules as available.
author: Chris Gardner

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Resource Manager subscription to configure before running PowerShell

inputs.name: ResourceGroupName
inputs.label: Resource group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of a resource group.

inputs.name: automationAccountName
inputs.label: Automation Account
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the Azure Automation Account.

inputs.name: ConfigurationParametersPath
inputs.label: Configuration parameters path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Any parameters needed by the configurations to compile in a json or psd1 file. Any credentials should be the name of a credential in Azure Automation's credntial store. Check the documentation for formats accepted.

inputs.name: Psd1SourcePath
inputs.label: Configuration Data Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the source folder, or file on the local machine, or a UNC share. This will filter for any PSD1 files within it based on input from the Configuration Parameters input.
